clinical_study.brief_title: MRI Maker of Perioperative Neurocognitive Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: MRI Marker of Postoperative Delirium and Delayed Neurocognitive Recovery

brief_summary.textblock: Periperative neurocognitive disorder(PND) is consistently associated with increased morbidity and mortality, but its mechanisms remain unclear. Moreover, valid biomarkers for the prediction or diagnosis of the development of delayed neurocognitive recovery in aged patients have not been identified so far. The purpose of this study is trying to find the functional MRI marker of PND.

primary_outcome.measure: MRI markers of PND before 7th day after surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the day before surgery to the 7th day after surgery
primary_outcome.description: To analysis the association of volume of hippocampus measured by MRI and the occurrence of PND identified at the 7th day after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: MRI markers of PND before 12 month after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the 7th day after surgery to 12 month after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: To analysis the association of volume of hippocampus measured by MRI and the occurrence of PND identified at the 12 months after surgery

study_pop.textblock: Patients elder than 60 years old elective to undergo lower limb surgery and conform to the including criteria would be recruited.

Exclusion Criteria:
- Existing cerebral disease, or have a history of neurological and psychiatric diseases including AD, stroke, and psychosis
- Existing cognitive impairment as evidenced by Mini-Mental State Examination scores below 24
- Several audition or vision disorder
- With standard contraindications to MRI examinations
- Unwillingness to comply with the protocol or procedures.
